intro: Navarretia squarrosa, commonly known as the desert navelwort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Borage family (Boraginaceae) and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, woolly leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Navarretia squarrosa is often found in rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
